channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: WGAのストライキが100日目に突入：大手スタジオとの交渉は行き詰まり、作家たちは自分たちの要求を無視していると抗議している（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
The WGA strike hits 100 days: negotiations with major studios are stalled and writers are protesting what they describe as a disregard for their demands  —  The Hollywood writers' strike marks 100 days on Wednesday with contract talks stalled and people on the picket lines protesting what they describe as a disregard for their demands.

item.title: フォックス・ニュースが8月23日に第1回討論会を主催した後、RNCは9月27日に行われる第2回共和党大統領予備選討論会のホストにフォックス・ビジネスを選んだ（Alex Isenstadt/Politico）
item.description:
Alex Isenstadt / Politico:
The RNC picks Fox Business to host the second GOP presidential primary debate on September 27, after Fox News hosts the first debate later on August 23  —  It's now two-for-two for the Murdoch empire when it comes to presidential candidate forums.  —  The Republican National Committee …

item.title: ソース英国最大の有料放送局であるコムキャスト傘下のスカイ、視聴率低下により2004年にBBCから獲得したアカデミー賞の放送権を放棄（Variety紙）
item.description:
Variety:
Source: Comcast-owned Sky, the UK's largest pay-TV broadcaster, gives up the rights to broadcast the Oscars, acquired from the BBC in 2004, as ratings decline  —  After a 20-year pact, the Oscars will no longer broadcast on Sky in the U.K., Variety has confirmed.

item.title: X、小規模クリエイターへの広告収入支払いを開始、数千の特定アカウントへの支払いを公開後、支払いの計算方法は不明のまま（Elizabeth de Luna/Mashable）
item.description:
Elizabeth de Luna / Mashable:
X begins making ad revenue payouts to smaller creators, after releasing payments to thousands of select accounts; how payouts are calculated remains unclear  —  ‘$8 to make $370 is a fantastic ROI for something I do anyway,’ one creator tweeted. … X is finally paying smaller creators …

item.title: 米GizmodoのEIC、ダン・アッカーマン氏がアップルやテトリス・カンパニーなどを提訴、テトリスに関する著書を無断で長編映画にしたと主張（Blake Brittain/Reuters）
item.description:
Blake Brittain / Reuters:
Gizmodo EIC Dan Ackerman sues Apple, the Tetris Company, and others, claiming they adapted his book about Tetris into a feature film without his permission  —  Dan Ackerman, editor in chief of the tech-news website Gizmodo, filed a lawsuit in Manhattan federal court on Monday accusing Apple …

item.title: TikTokで最も活発に活動しているアフリカの国ケニアでは、クリエイターが抗議活動のライブストリームでお金を稼いでいる。
item.description:
Martin K.N Siele / Rest of World:
In Kenya, the most active African country on TikTok, creators make money with protest livestreams, which protesters say help them stay safe from police violence  —  At least 23 people have reportedly been killed as crowds oppose proposed tax increases.  —  • NAIROBI, KENYA

item.title: ノルウェーの新聞社Verdens Gangの "透明性ポータル "を見てみよう。記事の失敗で批判に直面した後、視聴者の信頼を向上させるために立ち上げられた。
item.description:
Sophie Culpepper / Nieman Lab:
A look at Norwegian newspaper Verdens Gang's “transparency portal”, launched to improve audience trust after facing criticism for a botched story  —  Readers “have to see this again and again and again, I think, before you really make an impact.”

item.title: ソニー・ピクチャーズ、第1四半期は前年同期比68％減の$115M、売上高は同6％減の$230B、2023年度の利益予想は据え置き、音楽利益は同20％増の$86M（Gavin J Blair/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Gavin J Blair / The Hollywood Reporter:
Sony Pictures reports Q1 profit down 68% YoY to $115M, revenue down 6% YoY to $2.3B, and forecasts unchanged FY 2023 profit; Music profit rose 20% YoY to $86M  —  Sony Corp. reported its latest financial results in Tokyo on Wednesday, with revenue at the pictures division down slightly to $2.3 billion.

item.title: 2021年のジャーナリスト、ピーター・R・デ・フリース殺害事件が波紋を広げているオランダで、ジャーナリズムに対する敵対的な環境がますます強まっている。
item.description:
Committee to Protect Journalists:
A look at the increasingly hostile environment for journalism in the Netherlands, where the 2021 killing of journalist Peter R de Vries has had ripple effects  —  On a small street off Amsterdam's bustling museum district, there is no indication of the 2021 event seared into the memories of the Dutch press corps - at least not yet.

item.title: パラマウント社がサイモン＆シュスター社をKKRに売却する16.2億ドルの取引についての分析。
item.description:
Joe Pompeo / Vanity Fair:
An analysis of Paramount's $1.62B deal to sell Simon & Schuster to PE firm KKR, in which Simon & Schuster employees receive an ownership stake in the company  —  CEO Jonathan Karp is touting the “commitment to growth” promised by storied investment firm KKR, which has inked a $1.6 billion deal to buy S&S from Paramount Global.

item.title: オーストラリアのABCが、TikTok、フェイスブック、インスタグラムにリソースをシフトする中、「有害なやりとり」とコストを理由に、Xの4つのアカウントを除くすべてのアカウントを閉鎖（Amanda Meade/The Guardian）
item.description:
Amanda Meade / The Guardian:
Australia's ABC shutters all but four of its accounts on X, citing “toxic interactions” and cost, amid shifting resources to TikTok, Facebook, and Instagram  —  The public broadcaster says interactions on the platform are ‘toxic’ as it closes almost all its Twitter accounts

item.title: アルバニー公共図書館は、同市の地元紙タイムズ・ユニオンと提携して一連の記事を作成し、地元の人々がどのようなニュースを必要としているかを調査した（Kate Harloe/Popula）。
item.description:
Kate Harloe / Popula:
The Albany Public Libraries partnered with the city's local paper, the Times Union, to produce a series of articles and examine what kind of news locals needed  —  checking out the news at the Albany Public Library  —  On a cold Saturday last November I needed a place to work …

item.title: エンデヴァーによると、現在進行中のハリウッド・ストライキにより、同社は月2,500万ドル（約25億円）の売上を失う見込みだが、同社は顧客と共に立ち上がるとのこと（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Endeavor says the ongoing Hollywood strikes are expected to the cost the company ~$25M per month in revenue, but the company will stand with its clients  —  The full effects of the Writers Guild and SAG-AFTRA strikes will be felt in WME parent Endeavor's third quarter earnings report.

item.title: グーグル、YouTubeが購入者を欺いたとの報道を受け、広告動画フォーマットの名称を「インストリーム広告」から「スキップ可能広告」に変更（Catherine Perloff/Adweek）
item.description:
Catherine Perloff / Adweek:
Google changes the name of one of its advertising video formats from “in-stream ads” to “skippable ads”, after a report accused YouTube of misleading buyers  —  What was once in-stream ads are now skippable ads  —  Google removed “in-stream” classification from the name of one of its video formats.

item.title: ESPNがペンにESPN Betでのブランド使用を認める契約は10年間で20億ドルの価値がある：現金15億ドルとペンの株を購入する約5億ドル相当のワラント（Katherine Sayre/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Katherine Sayre / Wall Street Journal:
ESPN's deal allowing Penn to use its brand for ESPN Bet is worth $2B over 10 years: $1.5B in cash plus warrants worth about $500M to purchase shares in Penn  —  Barstool Sportsbook will be rebranded as ESPN Bet; deal includes $1.5 billion in cash over 10 years
